pageContext.claim: “You can look at every administration in the history of this country. Nobody -- nobody has ever had hundreds of people not approved after three and a half years.”
pageContext.analysis: Some nominations have been held in limbo for some time, a problem exacerbated by the coronavirus pandemic. But it's not "hundreds," just 79 who have been nominated but not yet confirmed, according to a tracker from the Washington Post and non-partisan Partnership for Public Service. Trump also has failed to send the Senate nominees for 166 of the 750 key administration positions requiring confirmation.
